summary: The Nuclear Recycling Efficient Fuels Utilizing Expedited Licensing Act of 2025 (Nuclear REFUEL Act of 2025) aims to amend the Atomic Energy Act of 1954. It modifies the definition of a 'production facility' related to nuclear fuel reprocessing. Specifically, the bill excludes equipment that reprocesses spent nuclear fuel using a method that doesn't separate plutonium from other transuranic elements. The bill was introduced in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
